I don’t usually answer LinkedIn trolls, but today I will.
“You are a fool”, “You are a waste of time”… and the list goes on.
Friday, this individual kept trolling me. I ignored them, then they started to troll commenters on my post.
Some people say kill them with kindness but I don’t subscribe to this strategy.
I am accustom to the personal attacks. I will not even lower myself to get into an online battle. I let it roll off like water off a duck’s back.
However, I will not tolerate personal attacks to my contacts here who I value and respect. We can agree to disagree however, the name calling is getting out of hand.
Read full post here: "Dealing with Trolls: Don't Feed Them and Don't Be One" - https://lnkd.in/dmFpzQJ
There is a reason trolls live under the bridge, block them and send them back where they belong.

Staffing Operations Manager / SR Technical Recruiter

~Responsible for full cycle recruiting (source, screen, interview, reference, negotiation, offer) in engineering, finance, ops and technical. ~Assigned to a variety of reqs as well as being a point person for assisting other recruiters in difficult searches (targeted sourcing, networking, Boolean)~As Operations Manager, I prepare and deliver training processes for ATS, policy and procedure for recruiting processes across the board, negotiate contracts for staff tools~Reviewing existing policy and procedure for inefficiencies, bottlenecks and making recommendations to VP of TA for further action, solution~Various research projects that include Dynamic Req Approval routing for N Americas to mirror process in EMEA and LATAM. Creating a plan that would include resolution to dynamic req approval via system (Taleo) and also devising a plan that would roll that into system generated, standard offer approval process via Taleo.

~Responsible for full cycle recruiting (source, screen, interview, reference, negotiation, offer) ~Single point of contact for Media Works NOC expansion project (East Coast locations as related to the Comcast acquisition and need to combine network efforts)~Primary recruiting responsibility is for Core IT Infrastructure / Operations, Broadcasting Environment, Marketing, Branding~Assist in preparing and delivering staff trainings~Point of contact (SME) for process / policy / OFCCP for team as well as coaching for Boolean sourcing strategies, HTML inquiries (for job posting purposes)~Average of 10 placements per month (not agency assisted)
Technical Recruiter / Business Online Services Group / Office 365 / Cloud

Responsible for full cycle recruiting (source, screen, interview, reference, negotiation, offer) Workloads vary up to 100 open requisitionsPrimary recruiting responsibility is for Core Tech positions and UX roles and Operations EngineeringBusinesses supported included Business Online Services (cloud), Management Services Division and MSN Online.Partner with hiring managers to effectively source, screen and interview candidates through sourcing sessions and other methodsStrategic sourcing (worked as a loaned resource over multiple groups within MSN for regional staffing events)Mentor and on-board new / contract SCs / Sourcer’s (techniques, plans, creating effective search strings) Xpten / E-rec (applicant tracking system / ATS) SME – delivering training, best practicesNGS Champion (New Generation System / WORLD WIDE MICROSOFT ATS implementation team / applicant tracking system implementation team)Member of Tagging / Sharing review committee for Microsoft World WideParticipate as panel member, representing Microsoft on Career Discussion panels within the community on various staffing, job search related topicsManaged project to improve IV to Hire ratios in MSD – involved putting together a team of ‘point’ hiring managers, identifying the possible problems in the process and putting a consistent plan in place going forward.  It was determined that the manager screens were not as effective as they could have been.  I helped design templates that the managers (and delegates) will use to do all technical screens.  This project is still in process but it seems that the new process is slowly moving the dial on IV to Hire ratios. Diversity Leadership Team member – participate in regular meeting and planning sessions, participate and lead diversity specific sourcing sessions, developed diversity focused mentoring programsCreated content and delivered various trainings cross group within Staffing / Business environments

Angela is one of a kind.  She has both a depth and breathe of experience within the talent function that makes her a strong utility player.  She is always eager to take on project and program work in addition to her full time Recruiting workload.  Angela is magnetic, charismatic and has a real zest for life and for talent acquisition.  These qualities, coupled with her knowledge base and experience, make her a stand out in terms of being a highly productive Recruiter and contributing member of a team.  I have had the privilege of working with Angela several times over her career since Microsoft and wish her continued success in all her future endeavors.

October 16, 2012, Dana managed Angela directly

Angela is one of the most talented Recruiters I've ever had the pleasure to work with. In the current day and age of "send out 200 in-mails and see what sticks" recruiting, Angela approaches recruiting as an art - she has a passion for her work, asks the right questions, connects the dots in unique ways and builds solid and lasting relationships with candidates, HR partners and hiring managers.  Angela is a true staffing consultant and subject matter expert.  I would consider it a privledge to have her on my team again one day.

summary: Talent Acquisition / Technical RecruiterFull Life-cycle recruiting, both technical and non-technical ~Recruiting experience in the following disciplines: Engineering , Telecom, Operations, Electro / Mechanical / Avionics Engineering, Graphics / Web Design, Administration, Marketing, Sales, Program & Project Managers, Entertainment / Broadcast & Media Operations (various Engineers, Digital Media, Creative, Production [pre and post], Editors)~Agency and Corporate recruiting experience.~Experienced in performing all phases of recruiting cycle: identification of qualified individuals through various sources, evaluation of candidates, qualification and preparation of candidates, in-house interviews execution, reference checks, offer negotiation, closing, and referral and lead generation. ~Expert account management skills; well versed in developing and maintaining loyal relationships with candidates and clients ~Participant and driver of corporate recruiting programs including but not limited to Diversity Initiatives, Executive Diversity Initiatives, College Recruiting, Community Mentoring and Outreach (High School Programs)
